III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-resident
Description ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Around 1/5/23, youth at facility was raped by a staff member.
Youth had bruises on their left arm as a result. There may be
bruising on the youth's chest as well. Youth is currently suicidal.
Investigation On 1/12/2023 contact was made with the complaint via telephone.
No additional concerns were noted.
On 1/12/2023 an in-person interview was held with the Residential
Care Supervisor (RCS) and the Chief Administrator at the Vassar
building. The management staff was advised of the special
investigation and provided clarifying information as to which staff
were present and working on 1/05/2023. Historical information
about the youth was provided.
On 1/12/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 7 at
Vassar house. He advised that he is the assigned PREA
representative at the agency that he was also investigating the
incident. He provided his contact information and requested
updates as the investigation continued.
On 1/12/2023 in-person contact was made with Youth A at Vassar
house. She reported that she attends therapy twice per week and
is working on tools and techniques to assist in addressing her
feelings. Youth A inquired if I was here to discuss “the incident”
with her. I informed her that I was aware of her concerns and
would be working with other DHHS staff to obtain additional
information.
On 01/17/2023 Youth A participated in an CAC interview in
Tuscola County. DHHS specialist, CAC Interviewer, Vassar
Police were present at the facility, and I was present via video.
Youth A reported that while asleep in bed on the night in question,
she woke up from a nightmare and was gasping for air. Youth A
said that a male staff came over and put his hand over her mouth
2

and then attempted to put his hands in her shorts. Youth A said
she wasn't sure if the staff was male or female and described the
staff as short and stocky. Youth A reported that the staff left a
bruise on her upper arm because he grabbed her arm. She
reported that she "freaked out" when this happened, and the staff
told her that she would be ok and that he did not mean to hurt her.
Youth A reported that she then went back to bed and the staff left
the unit. Youth A denied that she ever told staff or anyone else
until she went to the hospital. She reported that the incident
occurred between 1am and 2am on a Thursday. Youth A was
prompted to provide more detail of the incident by the CAC
interviewer. She further reported that when the staff put his hand
over her mouth, he told her to "be quiet" and that everything was
going to be alright. She further reported that the staff put his hand
up her shorts and touched her underwear and thigh. She stated
that she believed the staff was trying to rub the outside of her
vagina on top of her underwear. She described that staff as
having a deep voice, wearing dark colored clothing (either red or
black) and wearing cologne. She reported that the staff rubbed
her vagina for one or two minutes and then removed his hand
from her mouth. She then reported that the staff then attempted
to touch her breast but did not because she moved. She identified
this as how she got a mark on her chest. Youth A then changed
her story and reported that the staff put his hand underneath her
t-shirt and made an attempt to get under her bra, but then just
squeezed one of her breasts on top of her bra. She denied that
the staff touched her anywhere else. Youth A reported no one
else saw or heard what happened. She then identified the staff as
Staff 1 and reported that she has seen him at the facility three
times prior to this incident. She reported that there was one other
female staff in the unit, she could not remember who it was, but
she did not think the staff saw anything. Youth A reported that
she attempted to go and talk to staff after this occurred, but the
staff did not respond because she was asleep. Youth A then
added that the staff told her that if she told anyone what
happened, he would make sure she did not get to go home.
Youth A identified the supervisor on duty as Staff 5. Youth A then
reported that Staff 1 was her one-on-one staff on this date.
On 01/20/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at the
Vassar Police Department. The DHHS specialist and Vassar
Police Officer participated in this interview also. Staff 1 reported
being employed by the agency for about four weeks as a youth
care worker on second shift. His last day at the facility was
1/9/2023. Staff 1 reported he quit due to the way the staff were
talking to the youth. He said he heard a staff tell Youth C that she
3

smelled like "old period blood". He reported that he was not able
to recall who the staff was.
He said on another occasion, Youth C stated she was going to
swallow a screw and a staff told her they weren't going to stop her
from doing it. He reported not being able recall the name of that
staff either. Staff 1 confirmed that he was in unit four but did not
work on Thursday 1/05/2023. He reported working on Tuesday
and Wednesday. He reported that his shift is from 2pm to 10pm
and that he may have worked over on some days, but never later
than midnight. He recalled working 3rd shift on one occasion on
12/31/2022. He confirmed that he did work in the same unit as
Youth A at some point but doesn’t remember the day as they often
moved between the different units. Staff 1 denied ever having to
restrain any youth. He denied having contact with any youth that
was “having a nightmare”. He denied touching any youth
inappropriately and said he may have touched a youth when she
attempted to go out the door but it was not in an inappropriate
manner. Staff 1 stated that youth were all in bed by 9:00 p.m.
every night. He said there was always another staff in the unit
when he was working. He denied that there was ever a time when
he was working alone with Youth 1. Staff 1 identified Staff 2 as a
supervisor with the agency. He reported that he would do walk
throughs in the unit and denied seeing Staff 2, or any other staff,
be inappropriate with youth.
On 1/20/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth B at
Vassar. The DHHS worker and Vassar Police Officer was also
present. She is currently in unit three but has been in unit four in
the past. She confirmed Youth A is still in unit four. Youth B
explained that one day last week Youth A told her that a 3rd shift
male staff caused bruising to her arm and back. Youth B recalled
that the only male that was working with them was Staff 1 and he
was with the RCS when he was in their unit. She denied any
other male staff have been in their unit during third shift. She said
she shared a p-aisle with Youth A and if someone were to walk
into their area, she would have woken up. Youth B described
herself as a light sleeper and stated she would hear any
movement that was occurring in her area. Youth B further reported
that Youth A had showed her the bruises on her upper arm before
these allegations and that they were caused from Youth A biting
herself. She stated that Youth A always has a lot of bruises from
self-harm. Youth B also reported that Youth A only told her that a
staff had grabbed her arm and back. She denied that Youth A told
her anything else happened. Youth B denied ever hearing Youth
A wake up gasping for air or screaming due to a nightmare.
4

On 01/20/2023 a case conference was held with Vassar Police
Officer, DHHS specialist and myself at Vassar. The assigned
officer advised that he would be closing out the criminal complaint
as unfounded.
On 2/07/2023 and in-person interview was held with Youth C at
Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was also present for the
interview. She is currently in unit four and confirms that she was
previously placed in a unit with Youth A. She denied she and
Youth A ever shared a p-aisle or slept close to one another. She
denied Youth A ever woke up in the middle of the night gasping
for air or screaming. Youth C denied they ever had a male staff in
their unit at night. She said if they did, there would always be a
female staff present with them. She denied they are alone with
male staff. Youth C said that Youth A told people she was pinned
to her bed by a male staff, but she does not think this is true and
believes that Youth A is making it up. Youth C feels this way
because she reported that Youth A was laughing and smiling
when telling her about the allegations and also that Youth A told
her it occurred in a unit that they were not even in. Youth C
denied seeing any staff be inappropriate with Youth A or any other
youth. Youth C was asked about her recently swallowing
something. She reported that she swallowed a bolt roughly three
months ago that she got from the toilet. She admitted that she
had lied previously about swallowing something. She denied any
staff encouraged her or told her to swallow the bolt. She also
denied staff have ever called her names or said something mean
to her.
On 2/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was present for the
interview. Staff 2 has worked at the facility for thirteen years and
is currently a youth care worker supervisor. He typically works
second shift. He denied having any discipline within his employee
file. The allegations were addressed with Staff 2 and he reported
he typically doesn't work third shift and will rarely pick it up. He
confirmed that he has been mandated at times to work some
Thursdays and Fridays. He confirmed working the night of
1/5/2023. He said he was in unit three that night but would do
rounds in the other units. He said he would check in with staff but
was never alone in any of the units without another staff present.
He denied that there was ever a time that male staff may be alone
in the unit. He reported that they would get another female staff to
be with them. He denied being in Youth A’s unit and witness her
waking up gasping for air or appearing to have a nightmare. He
denied ever being alone with Youth A and denied ever being
5

inappropriate with her or any youth. He also denied Youth A
advised him of anything happening to her at nighttime or during a
midnight shift.
On 2/22/2023 an in-person interview was held at Vassar with Staff
3, Staff 4, and Staff 5. All three staff confirmed that they have
worked 3rd shift in a unit where Youth A was present. They all
denied Youth A ever reporting being assaulted by a male or
female staff. They all confirmed that male staff are not left alone
in the unit with the youth and deny every seeing any male or
female staff be inappropriate with the youth. Lastly none of the
staff recalled an incident where Youth A woke up gasping for air or
screaming from a nightmare.
On 2/28/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 6 at
Vassar House. She has worked at the facility for six months as a
youth care worker. She typically works second shift but reported
she will pick up third shift two to three times per week. She is not
assigned to a specific unit, stating it varies depending on the day.
Staff 6 reported she has worked with male staff on third shift. She
said it doesn't happen very often and they typically come from
other sites on campus and don't usually work at Vassar House.
She said she worked with Staff 1 on two different occasions. She
said once was on second shift and they were in unit one but
stated that Youth A was not in that unit. She reported the other
time was on third shift and he gave her a break for ten minutes.
She couldn't remember what unit this was in but didn't think it was
the unit Youth A was assigned to. She stated Staff 1 would have
been the only staff in the unit because she was alone that night.
She denied there has ever been a time when Youth A has woken
up gasping for air or appeared fearful of something. She also
denied Youth A has ever talked to her about being assaulted at
night by a staff.
On 3/08/2023 a DHHS closing case conference was held. The
assigned DHHS specialist advised that there were no confirmed
findings for the case.
The following documents were reviewed as a part of the
investigation:
• Photos of Youth taken by On-Call DHHS specialist
Documentation of reported bruises
• Staff logbooks for 01/01/2023 to 01/07/2023.
Staff 1 was not listed as a staff working 3rd shift or on 1/04, 1/05 or
1/06. No issues or concerns were noted during the shifts.
Discrepancies regarding scheduled staff were noted in the logbook and
6

clarification was obtained from management. Management provided an
updated copy of staffing and confirmed which staff was scheduled and
worked on identified days. Logbook also confirmed that Staff 1 was not
a scheduled midnight staff on 1/05/2023.
• Trauma Assessment of Youth A
The assessment was completed by Easter Seals on 4/27/2022. It
noted that Youth A has exhibited a lot of trauma which included the
death of her younger brother and abuse she received while residing
with her mother. She has experienced both physical and sexual abuse
by her mother's partners. She has been exposed to physical abuse,
neglectful home environment, emotional abuse, exposure to chronic
violence, sexual abuse, impaired parenting, drug activity, lengthy
separation from parents, loss of significant people and placement
outside of her home. It noted that Youth A struggles with her behaviors
with both staff and peers at her current placement. She also has been
inappropriate with male staff and will "latch on" to people that is not
fitting for their relationship. She required redirection of appropriate
boundaries. She has been diagnosed with PTSD.
• Medical Records of Youth A from McLaren Bay Regional
Youth A was seen in the emergency room on 1/10/2022 due to having
suicidal ideations. She was admitted by Doctor Nicholas Cost. She
reported her plan was to choke herself due to it being the anniversary
of losing a family member. She also said a staff at the facility had
recently sexually assaulted her. An examination was completed and
noted, "there is bruising that appears superficial over the left shoulder
area. There is a small bruise over the left upper chest wall. There is a
mild, small abrasion over the left upper back area. Multiple self-inflicted
wounds that appear superficial over the left anterior forearm". She was
discharged back to the facility on 1/11/2023.
• Safety Plan of Youth A
Documented triggers for youth and action of staff to keep her safe.
Analysis At the conclusion of the interviews there was not sufficient
evidence to support allegations that Youth A had been sexually
assaulted by Staff 1. Youth A provided conflicting descriptions of
the assailant and conflicting information. Further, other youth that
were interviewed denied hearing Youth A waking, screaming or
gasping for air while being asleep in the unit. Youth B reported
that she viewed the bruises on Youth A prior to the alleged event
and that she saw Youth A engage in self harm and create the
bruises herself. Lastly both youth and staff that were interviewed
deny that male staff were working in the unit on that day.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status.
